summary: This is a Certificate of Authenticity of Business Records, signed by an IRS Criminal Investigation employee, declaring that attached records are authentic duplicates of originals kept in the regular course of business. It appears to be part of a document production related to an investigation.

persons.name: Hew Arid
persons.role: IRS Criminal Investigation employee, custodian of records
persons.context: Declares under penalty of perjury that attached business records are authentic duplicates of originals kept in the regular course of business.

events.title: Signing of Certificate of Authenticity
events.description: An IRS CI employee signs a certificate declaring the authenticity of attached business records for use in an investigation.

keyFacts: This document is a Certificate of Authenticity for business records, signed under penalty of perjury.
The signatory is an employee of IRS Criminal Investigation, acting as a custodian of records.
The certificate attests that attached records are exact duplicates of originals made in the regular course of business.
The document is dated January 21, 2020, indicating it was prepared for a legal or investigative proceeding.
